pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.2_0: The monks’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.3_0: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:0.5_0: The training rule on digging the earth
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.12_0: “... Foolish men, how can you dig the earth and have it dug?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.13_0: People regard the earth as conscious.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.14_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.15_0: the Buddha said, “And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.16.1_0: ‘If a monk digs the earth or has it dug, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.1_0: At one time the Buddha was staying at Aggāḷava Shrine.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.2_0: At that time the monks at Āḷavī were doing building work. And they dug the earth and had it dug.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.3_0: People then complained and criticized those nuns,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.4_0: “How can the Sakyan ascetics dig the earth and have it dug?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.5_0: But not soulling the Sakyan ascetics treading the same thing.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.6_0: The monks heard those people complaining,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.7_0: The monks of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.8_0: “How can those monks at Āḷavī dig the earth and have it dug?” ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:1.9_0: “Is it true, monks, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.10_0: A pile of soil or a pile of clay that has been rained upon for more than four months, this too is called “productive earth”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.12_0: just stones, just pebbles, just potsherds, just gravel, just sand, with little soil, with little clay; mostly stones, mostly pebbles, mostly potsherds, mostly gravel, mostly sand.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.13_0: If it is burnt, it is also called “unproductive earth”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.14_0: A pile of soil or a pile of clay that has been rained upon for less than four months, this too is called “unproductive earth”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.16_0: if he digs it himself, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.18_0: if she asks another, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.19_0: If he only asks once, then even if the other digs a lot, he commits one offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.2_0: and you have the same kind of perception ...
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.4_0: ... The monks who have been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of monk is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.6_0: there are two kinds of earth: productive earth and unproductive earth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.8_0: pure soil, pure clay, with few stones, with few pebbles, with few potsherds, with little gravel, with little sand; mostly soil, mostly clay.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.1.9_0: If it is unburnt, it is also called “productive earth”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.1_0: If it is earth, and he perceives it as such, and he digs it or has it dug, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he burns it or has it burnt, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.2_0: If it is earth, but he is unsure of it, and he digs it or has it dug, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he burns it or has it burnt, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.3_0: If it is earth, but he does not perceive it as such, and he digs it or has it dug, or he breaks it or has it broken, or he burns it or has it burnt, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.4_0: If it is not earth, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.5_0: If it is not earth, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.2.6_0: If it is not earth, and he does not perceive it as earth, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.13_0: Except with one who understands, true,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.2_0: if he says, “Consider this”, “Give this”, “Bring this”, “There’s need for this”, “Make this allowable;”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.4_0: When there’s no inclination there’s no coming and going.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.8_0: The tenth rule, the training rule on digging the earth, is finished.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc10:2.3.9_0: The first sub-chapter on lying is finished.
